intro: Eugenioides diengense, commonly known as the Dieng wild pepper, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruits are small, round berries that contain aromatic seeds. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
